participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

NKITFEQ_01.LongName: When I smell a sizzling steak or see a juicy piece of meat, I find it very difficult to keep from eating, even if I have just finished a meal.

NKITFEQ_02.LongName: I usually eat too much at social occasions, like parties and picnics.

NKITFEQ_03.LongName: I am usually so hungry that I eat more than three times a day.

NKITFEQ_04.LongName: When I have eaten my quota of calories, I am usually good about not eating any more.

NKITFEQ_05.LongName: Dieting is so hard for me because I just get too hungry.

NKITFEQ_06.LongName: I deliberately take small helpings as a means of controlling my weight.

NKITFEQ_07.LongName: Sometimes things just taste so good that I keep on eating even when I am no longer hungry.

NKITFEQ_08.LongName: Since I am often hungry, I sometimes wish that while I am eating, an expert would tell me that I have had enough or that I can have something more to eat.

NKITFEQ_9.LongName: When I feel anxious, I find myself eating.

NKITFEQ_10.LongName: Life is too short to worry about dieting.

NKITFEQ_11.LongName: Since my weight goes up and down, I have gone on reducing diets more than once.

NKITFEQ_12.LongName: I often feel so hungry that I just have to eat something.

NKITFEQ_13.LongName: When I am with someone who is overeating, I usually overeat too.

NKITFEQ_14.LongName: I have a pretty good idea of the number of calories in common food.

NKITFEQ_15.LongName: Sometimes when I start eating, I just can't seem to stop.

NKITFEQ_16.LongName: It is not difficult for me to leave something on my plate.

NKITFEQ_17.LongName: At certain times of the day, I get hungry because I have gotten used to eating then.

NKITFEQ_18.LongName: While on a diet, if I eat food that is not allowed, I consciously eat less for a period of time to make up for it.

NKITFEQ_19.LongName: Being with someone who is eating often makes me hungry enough to eat also.

NKITFEQ_20.LongName: When I feel blue, I often overeat.

NKITFEQ_21.LongName: I enjoy eating too much to spoil it by counting calories or watching my weight.

NKITFEQ_22.LongName: When I see a real delicacy, I often get so hungry that I have to eat right away.

NKITFEQ_23.LongName: I often stop eating when I am not really full as a conscious means of limiting the amount that I eat.

NKITFEQ_24.LongName: I get so hungry that my stomach often seems like a bottomless pit.

NKITFEQ_25.LongName: My weight has hardly changed at all in the last ten years.

NKITFEQ_26.LongName: I am always hungry so it is hard for me to stop eating before I finish the food on my plate.

NKITFEQ_27.LongName: When I feel lonely, I console myself by eating.

NKITFEQ_28.LongName: I consciously hold back at meals in order not to gain weight

NKITFEQ_29.LongName: I sometimes get very hungry late in the evening or at night.

NKITFEQ_30.LongName: I eat anything I want, any time I want.

NKITFEQ_31.LongName: Without even thinking about it, I take a long time to eat.

NKITFEQ_32.LongName: I count calories as a conscious means of controlling my weight.

NKITFEQ_33.LongName: I do not eat some foods because they make me fat.

NKITFEQ_34.LongName: I am always hungry enough to eat at any time.

NKITFEQ_35.LongName: I pay a great deal of attention to changes in my figure.

NKITFEQ_36.LongName: While on a diet, if I eat a food that is not allowed, I often then splurge and eat other high calorie foods.

NKITFEQ_37.LongName: How often are you dieting in a conscious effort to control your weight.

NKITFEQ_38.LongName: Would a weight fluctuation of 5 lbs affect the way you live your life.

NKITFEQ_39.LongName: How often do you feel hungry?

NKITFEQ_40.LongName: Do your feelings of guilt about overeating help you to control your food intake?

NKITFEQ_41.LongName: How difficult would it be for you to stop eating halfway through dinner and not eat for the next few hours?

NKITFEQ_42.LongName: How conscious are you of what you are eating?

NKITFEQ_43.LongName: How frequently do you avoid 'stocking up' on tempting foods?

NKITFEQ_44.LongName: How likely are you to shop for low calorie foods?

NKITFEQ_45.LongName: Do you eat sensibly in front of others and splurge alone?

NKITFEQ_46.LongName: How likely are you to consciously eat slowly in order to cut down on how much you eat?

NKITFEQ_47.LongName: How frequently do you skip dessert because you are no longer hungry?

NKITFEQ_48.LongName: How likely are you to consciously eat less than you want?

NKITFEQ_49.LongName: Do you go on eating binges though you are not hungry?

NKITFEQ_50.LongName: On a scale of 0 to 5, where 0 means no restrained eating (eating whatever you want, whenever you want it) and 5 means total restraint (constantly limiting food intake and never 'giving in'), what number would you give yourself?

Levels.0: 0-eat whatever you want, whenever you want it
Levels.1: 1-usually eat whatever you want, whenever you want it
Levels.2: 2-often eat whatever you want, whenever you want it
Levels.3: 3-often limit food intake, but often 'give in'

NKITFEQ_51.LongName: To what extent does this statement describe your eating behavior?  'I start dieting in the morning, but because of any number of things that happen during the day, by evening I have given up and eat what I want, promising myself to start dieting again tomorrow.'

NKITFEQ_52.Description: Factor 1 is the dietary-restraint factor containing 21-items. Factor I scores are composed of the sum of Part I and Part II measures. Part I: Items answered as true: 4, 6, 14, 18, 23, 28, 32, 33, and 35; Items answered as false: 10, 21, and 30; Part II: Items 37, 38, 40, 42, 43, 44, 46, 48, and 50 | Calculation = [NKITFEQ_04] + [NKITFEQ_06] + iif([NKITFEQ_10] == 0,1,0) + [NKITFEQ_14] + [NKITFEQ_18] + iif([NKITFEQ_21] == 0,1,0) + [NKITFEQ_23] + [NKITFEQ_28] + iif([NKITFEQ_30] == 0,1,0) + [NKITFEQ_32] + [NKITFEQ_33] + [NKITFEQ_35] + iif([NKITFEQ_37] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_38] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_40] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_42] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_43] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_44] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_48] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_50] >= 3,1,0)

NKITFEQ_53.Description: Factor 2, disinhibition, is composed of 16 items assessing the lability in behavior and weight. Factor 2 scores are composed of the sum of Part I and Part II measures. Part I: Items answered as true: 1, 2, 7, 9, 11, 13, 15, 20, 37, and 36. Items answered as false: 16, 25, and 31; Part II: Items 45, 49, and 51. | Calculation = [NKITFEQ_01] + [NKITFEQ_02] + [NKITFEQ_07] + [NKITFEQ_9] + [NKITFEQ_11] + [NKITFEQ_13] + [NKITFEQ_15] + iif([NKITFEQ_16] == 0,1,0) + [NKITFEQ_20] + iif([NKITFEQ_25] == 0,1,0) + [NKITFEQ_27] + iif([NKITFEQ_31] == 0,1,0) + [NKITFEQ_36] + iif([NKITFEQ_45] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_49] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_51] >= 3,1,0)

NKITFEQ_54.Description: Factor 3 measures the perception of hunger with 14-items. Factor 3 scores are composed of the sum of Part I and Part II measures. Part I: Items answered as true: 3, 5, 8, 12, 17, 19, 22, 24, 26, 29, and 34; Part II: Items 39, 41, and 47 | Calculation = [NKITFEQ_03] + [NKITFEQ_05] + [NKITFEQ_08] + [NKITFEQ_12] + [NKITFEQ_17] + [NKITFEQ_19] + [NKITFEQ_22] + [NKITFEQ_24] + [NKITFEQ_26] + [NKITFEQ_29] + [NKITFEQ_34] + iif([NKITFEQ_39] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_41] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_46] >= 3,1,0) + iif([NKITFEQ_47] <= 2,1,0)
